result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/29/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

11:09 AM Defendant Leroy McCambry in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Julie B. from Dane County Pretrial Services also at counsel table. 
Court and parties address multiple Pretrial Services Violation Reports. Statement by ADA Verhoff requesting cash bail be imposed. Statement by Attorney Breun regarding bail. Court sets cash bail in the amount of $350 and removes Dane County Pretrial Services. Previously posted bond to apply. All other conditions remain the same.
DCPS Violation Report and Court's Response: all violations will be addressed at 9/29/22 bail hearing
DCPS Violation Report
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail Bond Hearing rescheduled from September 30, 2022 to September 29, 2022
DCPS Violation Report

ADDRESS INFO for Leroy McCambry
Current: c/o The Beacon, 615 E Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: c/o DCJ,
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DCPS Violation Report; the Court requests a bail hearing asap in response
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $350 (per case). $350 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report immediately upon being released from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with HRS. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 2
